snippet: A slim victory, a lack of majority in Congress and a revitalized grass-roots opposition are among the obstacles Enrique Peña Nieto, the president-elect, faces.
abstract: Enrique Pena Nieto, Mexico's president-elect, may be hobbled by a slim victory, a lack of majority in Congress and a revitalized grass-roots opposition; some analysts doubt that Nieto will be able to fulfill his campaign promises of quelling drug violence and restoring economic stability.

byline.contributor: Karla Zabludovsky and Randal C. Archibold contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A slim victory, a lack of majority in Congress and a revitalized grass-roots opposition are among the obstacles Enrique Peña Nieto, the president-elect, faces.

headline.seo: Mexico’s New President Faces Uphill Fight
headline.main: Narrow Victory for Mexico’s New Leader Signals Bigger Challenges Ahead
headline.print_headline: Narrow Victory for Mexico’s New Leader Signals Bigger Challenges Ahead
